## {{< fa scroll >}} Description
Data management is the process of handling, organizing, documenting, and preserving data used in a project/research. It helps your research outcomes be transparent, maximizing your work's practical use and value. This lesson provides an overview of all the meaningful steps in a research project and dives into{< fa check >}} how to plan for successful data management.


## {< fa check >}} Prerequisites
None

## {{< fa bullseye >}} Learning Goal
- Understand the importance and benefits of data management
- Apply the Data Life Cycle steps to organize and plan a research project
- Describe the major components of data management plans
- Know about metadata main guidelines
- Become familiar with data repositories, what they are and how they work



## <i class="fa-regular fa-clock"></i> Duration
1 hour
